intro: Neobaronia phyllanthoides, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a prominent central pistil surrounded by five pale yellow petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and features palmate leaves with a velvety texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Neobaronia phyllanthoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
